intro: Dorcoceras wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Dorcoceras wallichii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
